meanings.definition: The act of grouping items together for processing or treatment.
meanings.sent1: In the factory, the batching of raw materials is done efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The batching of medications in the pharmacy ensures accuracy and safety.
meanings.sent3: The chef's unique batching of ingredients created a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Her batching of tasks helped her stay organized and focused throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The batching of laundry made the chore much more manageable.

meanings.definition: A quantity of goods produced at one time.
meanings.sent1: The bakery displayed a fresh batch of cookies in the window.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a large batch of corn from the field.
meanings.sent3: The store offered a special discount on the last batch of shoes.
meanings.sent4: The delivery truck carried a batch of new furniture for the showroom.
meanings.sent5: The factory produced a large batch of toys for the holiday season.

meanings.definition: To group items together for processing or treatment.
meanings.sent1: She is batching the documents for scanning and filing.
meanings.sent2: The team will batch the orders to streamline the shipping process.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly suggested batching all the office supplies by color.
meanings.sent4: The software program allows users to batch photos for editing.
meanings.sent5: The gardener decided to batch the different types of seeds for planting.
